Object.Field: Set this option to True if you are using generic SQL syntax for aggregate expressions. Set this option to False if you are using Spark Python syntax for aggregate expressions. NOTE: If this option is set to False (non-default), and expression is a constant - specify expression as lit(<my constant value>) Check pyspark.sql.functions module reference for more info about lit function: pyspark.sql.functions.lit(col) - Creates a Column of literal value.

COMPONENT NAME: XKM Spark Aggregate COMPONENT VERSION: 1 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 12.1.3.0.1 or above
DESCRIPTION:
Aggregates data from multiple rows using various aggregate functions such as SUM, MIN, MAX and GROUP BY clause.

This option enables window aggregation. To be used in combination with WINDOW_LENGTH and SLIDING_INTERVAL options. For more information regarding Spark Window oprations refer to Spark Programming Guide: http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/streaming-programming-guide.html#window-operations
The duration of window in windowed computations

This option defines the duration of aggregation window in number of batch intervals. Default = 3. It will be later multiplied by the batch duration to give us the absolute Window duration. Example if WINDOW_LENGTH = 3 and spark.batchDuration = 10, the Window length used in Spark will be 30.
The interval at which the window operation is performed

This option defines the interval at which the window operation is performed in number of batch intervals. Default = 2. It will be later multiplied by the batch duration to give us the absolute value of Sliding interval. Example if SLIDING_INTERVAL = 2 and spark.batchDuration = 10, the Sliding interval used in Spark will be 20. Using a SLIDING_INTERVAL > 1 results in fewer RDDs being generated. The aggregation component will only output an RDD every SLIDING_INTERVAL batches. In case of complex mappings using e.g. joins this lower output frequency will impact join results if the two join sources use different windowing settings. SLIDING_INTERVAL should be shorter than spark.streaming.timeout, otherwise the streaming session will be shut down before any data could be gathered at the end of sliding interval. This results in no data returned from the stream.

This option enables stateful aggregation. To be used in combination with STATE_RETENTION_PERIOD and FORWARD_ONLY_UPDATED_ROWS options. When data must be aggregated across all data of a stream, stateful aggregation is required. In stateful aggregation Spark builds a so called "State" Stream containing the aggregated values for all keys. For every incoming RDD this state is updated, e.g. aggregated sums are updated based on new incoming data. By default a "State" Stream will output all stored values for every incoming RDD.
Time in seconds to retain a key/value aggregate inside the Spark state object

Time in seconds to retain a key/value aggregate inside the Spark state object. A key is removed from the Spark state object, when LastUpdated + StateRetentionTime < CurrentTime. If left blank, keys will be retained for an unlimited amount of time. Please note that this may lead to the Spark state object growing infinitely. This option only applies to keys that are no more in use, i.e. incoming RDDs do not contain the key anymore.
Only modified aggregate values are forwarded to downstream components
If set, only modified keys and aggregate values are forwarded to downstream components as opposed to all keys in the state.
